message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.SI, cs.IR. 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it deals with natural language processing tasks such as hate speech detection and offensive language identification. The use of a novel type of convolutional neural network and contextual embedding also suggests a focus on machine learning and artificial intelligence, which are covered by the sub-categories cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper's participation in SemEval 2019, a competition focused on natural language processing, further supports the likelihood of it belonging to cs.CL. The use of neural networks and embeddings also suggests a possible connection to cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) and cs.IR (Information Retrieval), which deal with analyzing and processing large amounts of data.
